cheatsheet.title: Create Model from XML Local File Source

intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to create a model from an XML local file source.

item.title: Create XML Local File Source Connection

description.b: Follow the steps below to create a Teiid XML File Connection profile

subitem.label: Launch New XML Local File Source Connection Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Specify unique name and optional description and click Next >
2) Browse to select a local file or enter a file path
3) Click Finish

item.title: Create Model From XML File Source

description.b: Follow the steps below to create a relational model by importing data via your XML connection profile.

subitem.description:
1) Select the XML Import Mode: Local File System, then click Next >
2) Select XML Data File Source connection profile
3) Check the XML source file in the Available XML Data Files list
4) Browse to select the location for Source Model Definition
5) Enter valid unique source model name and click Next >
6) View the contents of your XML file in the top panel
7) Select a primary or root element and right-click Set As Root Path
8) Select elements and click Add selection as new column to customize the generated data transformation
9) Click Next >
10/ Browse to select the view model location. Browse to select or enter the view model name and view table name.
11) Click Finish

description.b: Follow the steps below to preview data from your newly generated XML view table.

subitem.description:
1) Click the browse "..." button to select the newly created view table
2) Click OK to execute the query
3) Results of the query will displayed in the SQL Results view

description.b: Follow the steps below to create a new VDB

subitem.description:
1) Select "..." button to browse and select project or folder location.
2) Enter a unique name for your VDB
3) Enter an optional description for your VDB
4) Select the Add button to choose models to go in your VDB
5) Click Finish

description.b: Follow the steps below to test the VDB

subitem.description:
1) Select "..." button to browse and select a VDB.
2) Click OK to deploy VDB and open connection in Data Source Explorer
3) Follow instructions in open SQL Scrapbook Editor
4) View your query results in the SQL Results view
